article.title: U.S. Army Procures Suicide Bomber Detector System
article.author: George Seffers
article.text: Science, Engineering and Technology Associates, Arlington, Virginia, was awarded about $48 million for the procurement of a counter-bomber system to provide detection capability of suicide bombers approaching a controlled access site.Â The U.S. Army Contracting Command, Natick, Massachusetts, is the contracting activity.
